summary: "The Fallen Angel" by Alexandre Cabanel depicts Lucifer, often linked to the Devil in Christian belief. Originally, Lucifer meant "morning star" or "light-bringer" in Latin, translating the Hebrew word for "Shining One." Over time, this term was used to describe the planet Venus and was even personified as a god. The Bible's King James Version used "Lucifer" to refer to the Devil, but modern scholars often translate it back to its original meaning of "morning star" in certain passages.
title: Lucifer
